content:
IEndpointIdentityProvider Interface

Definition

Provides the identity of an endpoint.

In this Article

public interface IEndpointIdentityProvider

Remarks

This interface is an extensibility point that SecurityTokenManagers can implement to provide a default EndpointIdentity for the service endpoint (for example, a DNS identity). This EndpointIdentity is published as part of the WSDL for the service endpoint.

Methods

GetIdentityOfSelf(SecurityTokenRequirement)

Gets the identity of the current endpoint, based on the security token requirements passed in.

public System.ServiceModel.EndpointIdentity GetIdentityOfSelf (System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement tokenRequirement);
Parameters
tokenRequirement
SecurityTokenRequirement

The SecurityTokenRequirement that describes security token requirements.

Returns
EndpointIdentity

The EndpointIdentity of the current endpoint.

Remarks

The tokenRequirement parameter contains the binding information of the endpoint, which is typically used in determining the EndpointIdentity for the endpoint. For example, if the binding is configured to do Kerberos-based authentication, the default identity returned will be a ServicePrincipalName (SPN) or UserPrincipalName (UPN).
